summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from July-August 2020, where the New York Field Office's Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) is requesting assistance from other agents for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, specifically for help with prepping items for discovery with an end-of-August deadline.

events.title: Initial FBI Assistance Request
events.description: Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) at the FBI New York Field Office sends out a request for assistance from other agents for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Office Meeting
events.description: An FBI agent schedules to come into the office (290 on the 9th floor) to discuss assistance with prepping discovery items for the Epstein/Maxwell case.

locations: 290 (9th floor, opposite side of entrance) - Likely an FBI office address in New York
keyFacts: The FBI's New York Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Squad (C-20) was actively seeking internal assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of late July 2020.
The assistance needed involved 'prepping items for discovery' with a stated turnaround time of 'end of August' for some items.
The request characterizes working on this case as a 'unique opportunity to assist with a high profile case.'
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination and resource allocation for the investigation months after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
